title: Spanish financial regulator warns investors over 18 unlicensed entities
description:
The list contains several crypto firms among companies trading without the correct licenses.

The National Securities Market Commission (CNMV), Spain’s principal financial regulator, has published a list of 18 companies operating in the country without a proper license. 

The CNMV published the list on Feb. 26, which includes several crypto companies, such as Bitbinx, Crytomerge and CryptoMaxiTrade. According to the regulator:

The regulator acknowledges that its powers are limited and advises concerned investors to consider going to the ordinary courts of justice. 

Read more

title: Bitcoin (BTC) makes parabolic move, hitting $57,000. It’s not stopping yet!
description: Bitcoin is in beast mode again. The king of the cryptocurrencies went from $51,000 to $57,130 in just a 24-hour period. The all-time-high for $BTC is now only $13,000 away. Could this be reached before the halving?

title: NSFOCUS Raises the Bar with NSFGPT AI Model Revolutionizing Security Operations

title: Bitcoin Soars Above $57,000, But Experts Warn of Potential Downturn

title: Hong Kong’s New Crypto Policies Tackle Illicit OTC Crypto Trade
description:
Hong Kong has reportedly initiated the implementation of stringent regulatory norms restricting over-the-counter (OTC) providers in an attempt to reduce illicit crypto trading activities. Chengyi Ong, APAC policy head at Chainalysis, commented that the regulatory framework would lead to “consolidation and a reduction” in malicious actors’ use of OTC platforms. According to Chainalysis data, around […]

The post Hong Kong’s New Crypto Policies Tackle Illicit OTC Crypto Trade appeared first on Coin Edition.
